title: Simplification and Improvement of MMS Approximation
description: Fair division of $m$ indivisible goods among $n$ agents with additive valuations.
results: Simple proof that a slight variant of the Garg-Taki algorithm gives $3/4$-MMS.
Proof that a slight variant of the Garg-Taki algorithm gives $(\frac{3}{4} + \min(\frac{1}{36} + \frac{3}{16n-4}))$-MMS.
Theorem 2: An algorithm that either performs one of the four valid reductions (as in the Garg-Taki algorithm) or does bag filling, cannot get better than $(\frac{3}{4} + \frac{3}{8n-4})$-MMS.
